content:
From: Gergely Buday <buday.gergely@uni-eszterhazy.hu>
Hi,

I am looking for journals that allow open access -- in the area of
verification.

Journal of Formalized Reasoning is such a one.

Journal of Automated Reasoning has a 2200 € open access fee.

What are other venues for this purpose?

  • Gergely

From: Sebastiaan Joosten <sjcjoosten@gmail.com>
There's Logical Methods in Computer Science which touches on verification, and of course our trusted AFP <https://www.isa-afp.org/> which you could argue may or may not be a journal.

From: Tobias Nipkow <nipkow@in.tum.de>
Indeed, the AFP is not a journal in the traditional sense. Submissions are
reviewed for Isabelle style but not for contents.

Tobias
smime.p7s

From: Lawrence Paulson <lp15@cam.ac.uk>
Hi Gergely,

Every journal that I know of allows you to put the final version of your accepted manuscript on your personal webpage provided it is accompanied by a link to the “official” version. ACM journals allow you to put the official link in any one place where it will be freely readable to all.

I am quite against page charges in principle, as they discriminate against all work that is not sponsored.

Larry
